meanings.definition: The action of inuring or becoming accustomed to something.
meanings.sent1: Her inurement to the cold weather allowed her to enjoy winter sports without discomfort.
meanings.sent2: His inurement to long working hours made him more productive at his job.
meanings.sent3: After years of camping in the wilderness, his inurement to bugs and dirt became legendary among his friends.
meanings.sent4: The soldier's inurement to danger was like a shield against fear in battle.
meanings.sent5: The inurement to spicy food was evident in her ability to eat the hottest peppers without flinching.

meanings.definition: The process of benefiting or gaining advantage from something.
meanings.sent1: The inurement of exercise on his health was clear from his improved stamina.
meanings.sent2: She saw the inurement of studying hard when she aced her exams.
meanings.sent3: His inurement of eating vegetables was rewarded with a healthier body.
meanings.sent4: The inurement of saving money allowed him to buy his dream car.
meanings.sent5: The inurement of practice on the piano was evident in her flawless performance.

meanings.definition: The state of being accustomed to hardship or difficulty.
meanings.sent1: Her inurement to challenges made her a resilient and strong individual.
meanings.sent2: The inurement to tough times helped him face any obstacle with determination.
meanings.sent3: His inurement to setbacks was like a superpower that kept him going.
meanings.sent4: The inurement to failures only fueled her desire to succeed.
meanings.sent5: Their inurement to adversity was the foundation of their unwavering bond.
